Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient expresses a desire for their family to understand their feelings, indicating a need for open communication.
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient has been actively communicating with their family, feeling relieved after sending a message. They are nervous but optimistic about an upcoming conversation with their family. Positive interactions with a colleague have boosted their confidence and mood.
Mental Health Observations: The patient reports feeling more hopeful and motivated following positive interactions, and they felt more confident during a meeting.
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient plans to have a family conversation, continue applying for jobs, and start volunteering to stay active. They also aim to incorporate mindfulness exercises into their routine.
Next Steps: The patient wants to focus on having the family conversation and beginning volunteer work.
